name: snappily
content:
snappily adverb
(STYLISHLY)
Add to word list
Add to word list
informal approving in a way that is modern and stylish: The sales team is usually pretty snappily dressed. She dresses snappily for her age, having an excellent eye for a bargain at the local charity shop.
More examplesFewer examplesCustomers of the hotel are welcomed by snappily turned-out staff dressed all in black.He is dressing snappily and going out on the town. He's not brash or sharp or snappily dressed.

snappily adverb
(EFFECTIVELY)
approving in a way that is immediately effective in getting people's attention or communicating an idea: The dialogue needs to be delivered more snappily. The snappily edited show was a huge success.
More examplesFewer examplesThe action moves along snappily enough, but the joy in a book like this isn't in the plot.Books on psychology sit next to gourmet cookery volumes, one of which is snappily titled "Potato".
